author: Ulisses Furquim
message:
pthread: fix building with or without pthread support

When some dependency checks were removed the pthread one went from
PTHREAD_H to PTHREAD and thus breaking the build.

However, the bigger problem is that we were always compiling with
pthread support because the dependency solver always defines
HAVE_PTHREAD_H even when we mark the config option PTHREAD as 'n'.
Previously autotools defined HAVE_PTHREAD_H when we had pthread.h
_and_ wanted to compile with pthreads support. Now that's not the
case anymore with Kbuild so we should test for PTHREAD in the code
and not HAVE_PTHREAD_H.

Note that the ldflags still need to be properly sorted out even though
everything compiles and works now.

Signed-off-by: Ulisses Furquim <ulisses.furquim@intel.com>

The macro SOL_FLOW_NODE_TYPE_DESCRIPTION_ENABLED on flow-buildopts

This patch fixes the issue, without that we could never build soletta

author: Vinicius Costa Gomes
message:
shared: Fix resolving the root dir for repeating prefixes

It is possible to have PREFIX multiple times in the path, for example,
the user sets PREFIX to '/home/user' and soletta is being built in
'/home/user/src/soletta/build/soletta_sysroot/' the resulting rootpath
would be '/'. The solution is work from the end of the path.

The helper strrstr() is introduced for this.

author: Leandro Pereira
message:
Build fix when building with upstream TinyDTLS

While using a fork of TinyDTLS obtained from the IoTivity project, the
build works fine.  However, when using the upstream TinyDTLS version,
the build does not work due to missing symbols in the library's debug
facilities.

Semaphore still complains about some flags to disable some compiler
warnings, but these will go away as soon as their compiler is updated
to something closer to the 21st century.

Also on this commit are a few OIC Client/CoAP build fixes. Not sure how
these problems got in, possibly a bad merge/rebase.

Signed-off-by: Leandro Pereira <leandro.pereira@intel.com>

author: Rodrigo Chiossi
message:
comms: Add generic MQTT flow module

This commit adds a generic client node for MQTT that can be used for
publishing messages and subscribing to topics.

The parameters for the MQTT connection can be configured both by config
and by sending a message to the specific flow port. The connection is
triggered when the first publish or subscribe trigger is activated and
is maintained afterwards. Connection problems are notified through the
ERROR out port.

Signed-off-by: Rodrigo Chiossi <rodrigo.chiossi@intel.com>

author: Murilo Belluzzo
message:
build: Fix race condition about 'sol_config.h'

When running make even without '-j', FLOW_OIC_GEN rule runs in parallel
with the remaining of Soletta build and was providing 'sol_config.h'
before it was needed most of the time and the build worked. But that
wasn't always the case, which was causing the build to fail for some
users.

This patch adds 'KCONFIG_AUTOHEADER' as dependency for remaining of the
build so it's always there when is needed. This also add a message when
'sol_config.h' is generated to make debug easier.

Signed-off-by: Murilo Belluzzo <murilo.belluzzo@intel.com>

author: Bruno Dilly
message:

external stuff, it could be enabled and tested

Issue spotted by Lei A Yang <lei.a.yang@intel.com>

author: Gustavo Lima Chaves
message:
log: log domain variables may not be referenced.

At least when the log domain is set to one different than the global
one, if the user issues no log calls in the Soletta app, that variable
will have no use in the code, thus leading to unused variable warnings.
We now tell, then, to the compiler, that the log domain variable may be
unused in the SOL_LOG_INTERNAL_DECLARE() macro.

author: Guilherme Iscaro de Godoy
message:
HTTP-Client: Cast size_t to curl_off_t.

On 32-bits platforms size_t will be smaller than curl_off_t, causing
curl to read wrong values when setting
curl_easy_setopt(curl, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDSIZE_LARGE, a_size_t_variable),
since curl will read the variable using va_args().
In order to fix this problem the size_t variable must be casted to curl_off_t.

Signed-off-by: Guilherme Iscaro <guilherme.iscaro@intel.com>

author: Gustavo Lima Chaves
message:
coap: sol_socket_recvmsg() can now calculate next message's size, only.

For all sol-socket implementations so far, make it possible to just peek
what would be the next datagram's size, so that users of
sol_socket_recvmsg() can allocate the exact number of bytes to hold that
content and save memory.

This special call would not work for non-datagram-typed sockets --
FIXMEs were put in place to generate errors on the call if that is the
case, in the future. Since we're only dealing with SOL_SOCKET_UDP-typed
sockets everywhere until now, I made the missing check at the RIOT's
socket implementation too.

In the long term, we may also have a version of this function that does
not allocate at all, but just sets a string slice (or sol-buffer) to
point at an internal struct with the datagram's contents. That makes
sense at least to some small OSses, where we can work, at least on
coap's receiving side, with zero copies (we just parse the packet at the
receiving routine and we're done).

Signed-off-by: Gustavo Lima Chaves <gustavo.lima.chaves@intel.com>
files_changed: src/lib/comms/sol-coap.c, src/lib/comms/sol-socket-dtls-impl-tinydtls.c, src/lib/comms/sol-socket-impl-linux.c, src/lib/comms/sol-socket-impl-riot.c, src/lib/comms/sol-socket-impl.h, src/lib/comms/sol-socket.c, src/lib/comms/sol-socket.h

author: Iván Briano
message:
build: Don't accept different *FLAGS between configuratio and built time

The CFLAGS and LDFLAGS passed by the user are used during configuration
time to check dependencies. Allowing the user to pass different flags
after configuration risks the features found at build time not matching
the ones found by the dependency resolver, breaking the build in the
best of cases.

To solve, don't use CFLAGS and LDFLAGS when setting the COMMON_*FLAGS
used by the build, preferring instead to always getting them from the
CONFIG_* values. And in order to simplify setting them, allow KConfig
to get the default of those values from variables passed by the user.

While we are at it, allow the same thing with the PREFIX value.

Signed-off-by: Iván Briano <ivan.briano@intel.com>

author: Gustavo Lima Chaves
message:
oic: Make it possible for OIC client functions to be cancelled

Most functions at sol-oic-client.h send CoAP packets to a server and
wait for multiple responses for them. One of the ways of killing that
packet context is returning false on the query callback. There were use
cases, though, where those functions were triggered again, but the
intention was to abandon older calls' contexts, what was not being done.
That could clutter sol-coap's layer with lots of pending contexts that
would only be freed after a long timeout. Thus, if those triggers would
happen too often, the memory usage would ramp up very quickly, what is
unnacceptable.

We now introduced struct sol_oic_pending, which is a handle to those
transactions, so that the user may cancel them. The CoAP layer was
adapted to make matches by pending contexts (using a weak pointer ref).

The name of a function there was changed to read better:
sol_oic_client_find_resource() -> sol_oic_client_find_resources().

The JS bindings to OIC were temporarily disabled until people owning it
are able to cope with these API changes.

Finally, once there was an effort for pointer-returning functions of
sol-oic-client.h to properly set errno on error scenarios, all the
function chain spawning from them was adapted to cope with that. I would
be a PITA to have those changes separated on another commit and still
compile.

Signed-off-by: Gustavo Lima Chaves <gustavo.lima.chaves@intel.com>
files_changed: bindings/nodejs/src/functions/oic-client-discovery.cc, bindings/nodejs/src/functions/oic-client-resource-ops.cc, bindings/nodejs/tests/helpers/observation-client.js, bindings/nodejs/tests/tests/OIC Discovery/client1.js, bindings/nodejs/tests/tests/OIC Discovery/client2.js, data/scripts/sol-oic-gen.py, src/lib/common/include/sol-log.h, src/lib/common/include/sol-mainloop.h, src/lib/common/sol-event-handler-contiki.h, src/lib/common/sol-mainloop-impl-contiki.c, src/lib/common/sol-mainloop-impl-glib.c, src/lib/common/sol-mainloop-impl-posix.c, src/lib/common/sol-mainloop.c, src/lib/comms/include/sol-coap.h, src/lib/comms/include/sol-oic-client.h, src/lib/comms/include/sol-oic.h, src/lib/comms/sol-coap.c, src/lib/comms/sol-lwm2m.c, src/lib/comms/sol-oic-client.c, src/lib/comms/sol-oic-security.c, src/lib/comms/sol-socket-dtls-impl-tinydtls.c, src/lib/comms/sol-socket-impl-contiki.c, src/lib/comms/sol-socket-impl-linux.c, src/lib/comms/sol-socket-impl-riot.c, src/lib/comms/sol-socket-impl-zephyr.c, src/lib/comms/sol-socket-impl.h, src/lib/datatypes/sol-vector.c, src/modules/flow/random/random.c, src/samples/coap/iotivity-test-client.c, src/samples/coap/oic-client.c, src/shared/sol-random.c, src/shared/sol-random.h

author: Bruno Bottazzini
message:
sol-conffile: warn if SOL_FLOW_MODULE_RESOLVER_CONFFILE is empty

When mistakenly  SOL_FLOW_MODULE_RESOLVER_CONFFILE is set empty
the WRN message that is sent is clueless.

Example:
WRN: ./src/shared/sol-util-file.c:209 sol_util_load_file_fd_buffer() r (-1) < 0
WRN: ./src/shared/sol-util-file.c:181 sol_util_load_file_fd_raw() r (-1) < 0
WRN: ./src/shared/sol-util-file.c:209 sol_util_load_file_fd_buffer() r (-1) < 0
WRN: ./src/shared/sol-util-file.c:181 sol_util_load_file_fd_raw() r (-1) < 0
WRN: ./src/shared/sol-util-file.c:209 sol_util_load_file_fd_buffer() r (-1) < 0
WRN: ./src/shared/sol-util-file.c:181 sol_util_load_file_fd_raw() r (-1) < 0

This patch instroduces a warning telling that the
SOL_FLOW_MODULE_RESOLVER_CONFFILE should not be empty.

Signed-off-by: Bruno Bottazzini <bruno.bottazzini@intel.com>

Closes gh-2093

author: Gabriel Schulhof
message:
OIC Server: Copy client address into request

The client address pointer given by CoAP cannot be stored in the OIC request
because it points to a stack variable and thus cannot be used asynchronously.
The client address must be copied into the request structure instead.

Fixes gh-2125

Signed-off-by: Gabriel Schulhof <gabriel.schulhof@intel.com>

author: Bruno Melo
message:
LWM2M: Remove finished bootstrap connection

This patch fixes a bug by removing the call to
sol_vector_clear(&conn_ctx->server_addr_list); inside bootstrap_request_reply()
and inserting a call to remove this connection from the client's connection
list inside bootstrap_finish(). This way, the connection is only (and properly)
removed after the Bootstrap Process has finished.

Signed-off-by: Bruno Melo <bsilva.melo@gmail.com>

author: Bruno Melo
message:
LWM2M: Minor: Fix order of params in a WRN message

The SOL_WRN call inside observation_request_reply had the client
name and path parameters in the wrong order

Signed-off-by: Bruno Melo <bsilva.melo@gmail.com>

author: Bruno Melo
message:
LWM2M: Fix check_authorization() for Access Control Objects

This patch fixes a bug when a given LWM2M Server who owns a given
Access Control Object Instance tries to modify it (for instance,
to add or remove an ACL for a given third-party LWM2M Server).

There was no way to modify an Access Control Object Instance, since
the check_authorization() would fail, not finding an Access Control
Object Instance related to the target instance - which should not
exist anyway. To fix it, a new condition was added in case the target
'obj_id' == 'ACCESS_CONTROL_OBJECT_ID', in which we should only look
for the target 'instance_id' itself and then inside the OWNER Resource,
not looking for ACLs or anything else.

Signed-off-by: Bruno Melo <bsilva.melo@gmail.com>

author: Bruno Melo
message:
Fix for sol_platform_get_machine_id

In case SOL_PLATFORM_LINUX is defined, this function expects an UUID
from the environment variable SOL_MACHINE_ID. It was only considering
UUIDs formed by 32 chars, and not 36.

This patch fixes that, leaving the length to be check by
sol_util_uuid_str_is_valid(), which already does that, and if the length
is 36, we remove the hyphens, since the returned value is expected to
contain only hex digits. Valid formats (32 chars and 36 chars + hyphens)
for UUIDs were obtained from [1].

[1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universally_unique_identifier

Signed-off-by: Bruno Melo <bsilva.melo@gmail.com>

author: Bruno Melo
message:
DTLS: Fix PSK ID length check

Only the PSK_KEY has a fixed size, the PSK_ID should have a max size,
so the check against SOL_DTLS_PSK_ID_LEN should use '>' instead of '!='.

Signed-off-by: Bruno Melo <bsilva.melo@gmail.com>

author: Bruno Melo
message:
LWM2M: Minor fixes for Client infra

Fixing default Response Code for Delete operation; changing from
SOL_COAP_RESPONSE_CODE_BAD_REQUEST to SOL_COAP_RESPONSE_CODE_NOT_ALLOWED.

Improve debugging message.

Fixing a compiler warning.

Signed-off-by: Bruno Melo <bsilva.melo@gmail.com>

author: Bruno Melo
message: LWM2M: Minor fix for sol_lwm2m_resource_init() docs\n\nSigned-off-by: Bruno Melo <bsilva.melo@gmail.com>

author: Bruno Melo
message:
LWM2M: Change type of bs_server->known_clients

This patch changes the type of the known_clients frield from
struct sol_lwm2m_bootstrap_server, to avoid possible issues in
case the user of the API deallocates the strings with the clients'
names.

Signed-off-by: Bruno Melo <bsilva.melo@gmail.com>

author: Flavio Ceolin
message:
test:lwm2m: Fix unused variable

The variable access_ocontrol_object is only used when we build with
DTLS, so it should be under a ifdef instruction to avoid

./src/test/test-lwm2m.c:1130:38: warning: ‘access_control_object’
defined but not used [-Wunused-const-variable=]

Signed-off-by: Flavio Ceolin <flavio.ceolin@intel.com>
